description: Number of ways to partition n labeled elements into 6 pie slices.
comments: For n>=6, a(n) is equal to the number of functions f: {1,2,...,n-1}->{1,2,3,4,5,6} such that Im(f) contains 5 fixed elements. - Aleksandar M. Janjic and _Milan Janjic_, Feb 27 2007
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 6..1000
Milan Janjic, Enumerative Formulas for Some Functions on Finite Sets
Index entries for sequences related to necklaces
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (21,-175,735,-1624,1764,-720).
maple: with (combstruct):ZL:=[S, {S=Sequence(U, card=r), U=Set(Z, card>=1)}, labeled]: seq(count(subs(r=6, ZL), size=m)/6, m=6..21); - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Mar 08 2008
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[120/((x - 1) (2 x - 1) (3 x - 1) (4 x - 1) (5 x - 1) (6 x - 1)), {x, 0, 30}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Oct 19 2013 *)
author: _Christian G. Bower_
